intro: Nelsonianthus, commonly known as the Nelson's glory, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the island of Saint Helena. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences that resemble a crown of flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a unique addition to specialized horticultural collections. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly the Saint Helena storm-petrel, highlighting its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nelsonianthus is considered a conservation priority.
